fields.value: Experience of Care and Patient-Physician Value Fit in Hispanic, African-American, and Caucasian Populations

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The project has the following specific goals and objectives: 1.	To obtain and describe the responses of Hispanic, African-American, and Caucasian patients with a common pool of health care providers to the CAHPS Clinician
& Group Adult Primary Care Survey (CAG). 2.	To obtain and describe the responses of Hispanic, African-American, and Caucasian patients with a common pool of health care providers to the Clinical Value Congruence scale, which measures the degree of fit between a patient and his/her provider on six dimensions of care values which are likely to vary both by culture and across individuals within the same culture and are unlikely to be associated with CAG composite scores.

keywordValue.value: Health care quality, access, and evaluation

topicClassValue.value: Health care quality, access, and evaluation

publicationCitation.value: Hasnain M, Schwartz A, Girotti J, Bixby A, Rivera L. (In press). Differences in patient-reported experiences of care by race and acculturation status. Journal of Immigrant and Minority Health.

value:
Schwartz A, Hasnain M, Girotti JA, Bixby AM, Castellano B, Garrido M, Gomez J. (2009, June). Ethnicity, Acculturation
& Clinical Values. Poster presentation at AcademyHealth 2009 Annual Research Meeting, Chicago, IL.
Patients of UIC Family Medicine providers at three community clinics, stratified by race (Caucasian, African-American, Hispanic)
